intro: Actinophloeus kerstenianus, commonly known as the Kersten's actinophloeus, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of red or pink. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
